## Elastic Net

```{r}
set.seed(1234)
# View help for function with:
# help(cv.glmnet)
lambdas <- 10^seq(2, -3, by = -.1)
# ridge with 10 fold cv, no intercept and no standardization
fit_en_cv_combined <- cv.glmnet(x = player_matrix_combined,
                          y = nba_margin_apm_model_data_combined$margin,
                          alpha = 0.5, # alpha set to 0.5 for Elastic Net
                          lambda = lambdas,
                          #type.measure = "mse",
                          intercept = FALSE,
                          standardize = FALSE)
```






```{r}
fit_en_cv_combined$lambda.min
```





```{r}
set.seed(1234)
plot(fit_en_cv_combined)
```



```{r}
set.seed(1234)
plot(fit_en_cv_combined$glmnet.fit, xvar = "lambda")
```


```{r}
set.seed(1234)
tidy_en_coef_combined <- tidy(fit_en_cv_combined$glmnet.fit)
tidy_en_coef_combined
```













```{r}
set.seed(1234)
rapm_en_coef_combined <- tidy_en_coef_combined |>
  filter(lambda == fit_en_cv_combined$lambda.min) |>
  # Convert term to numeric:
  mutate(term = as.numeric(term)) |>
  # Now join the player names:
  left_join(player_combined_df, by = c("term" = "player_id"))
```


```{r}
rapm_en_coef_combined_percentile <- rapm_en_coef_combined %>%
  mutate(estimate = round(estimate, 2)) %>%
  mutate(player_percentile = round(percent_rank(estimate), 2) * 100) %>%
  arrange(desc(player_percentile))
reactable(rapm_en_coef_combined_percentile)
```


```{r}
set.seed(1234)
rapm_en_coef_combined_percentile |>
  slice_max(estimate, n = 50) |>
  dplyr::select(term, player_name, estimate, minutes, player_percentile) %>%
  reactable()
```



```{r}
set.seed(1234)
rapm_en_coef_combined_percentile |>
  slice_min(estimate, n = 50) |>
  dplyr::select(term, player_name, estimate, minutes, player_percentile) %>%
  reactable()
```



```{r}
set.seed(1234)
rapm_en_coef_combined_percentile |>
  ggplot(aes(x = estimate)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  labs(x = "RAPM Elastic Net estimate", y = "Count", title = "Histogram of RAPM Elastic Net Model for NBA Players") +
  theme_bw()
```



```{r}
ggplot(data=rapm_en_coef_combined_percentile[1:30, ], aes(x=reorder(player_name, -estimate), y=estimate)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity", 
           position="dodge",
           fill = "blue") +
  geom_text(aes(label = estimate,
                hjust = -.25,
                vjust = 0.25),
            size = 2.1) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(), # Remove gridlines
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        panel.border = element_blank()) + # Remove box
  labs(title="Top 30 NBA Players RAPM Using Elastic Net Model (2020-2024)",
       y="RAPM EN Estimate",
       x="Player") +
  coord_flip()
```










```{r}
evaluate_elastic_net_model <- function(model, X, y) {
  # Predict using the best lambda (lambda.min)
  y_pred <- predict(model, newx = X, s = "lambda.min")

  # Number of observations
  n <- length(y)

  # Number of predictors used (degrees of freedom)
  lambda_idx <- which(model$lambda == model$lambda.min)
  p <- model$glmnet.fit$df[lambda_idx]

  # Residual Sum of Squares (SSE)
  sse <- sum((y - y_pred)^2)

  # Total Sum of Squares (SST)
  sst <- sum((y - mean(y))^2)

  # R-squared and Adjusted R-squared
  r_squared <- 1 - sse / sst
  adj_r_squared <- 1 - (1 - r_squared) * (n - 1) / (n - p - 1)

  # RMSE and MAE
  rmse <- sqrt(mean((y - y_pred)^2))
  mae <- mean(abs(y - y_pred))

  # Return as list
  return(list(
    R_squared = r_squared,
    Adjusted_R_squared = adj_r_squared,
    RMSE = rmse,
    MAE = mae
  ))
}

```



```{r}
en_results <- evaluate_elastic_net_model(fit_en_cv_combined, player_matrix_combined, nba_margin_apm_model_data_combined$margin)
print(en_results)
```
